definition: meager/slight/weak/ungenerous or unkind/frivolous/to despise/to belittle/to look down on/to approach or near
Holland/the Netherlands/abbr. for 荷蘭|荷兰[He2 lan2]
to carry on one's shoulder or back/burden/responsibility

sentences.english: Why do you eat that awful peppermint candy?
sentences.chinese: 你爲什麼喫那塊難喫的薄荷糖。

sentences.english: Nose liked the idea of wintergreen candy.
sentences.chinese: 翹鼻子喜歡薄荷糖的主意。

sentences.english: When the mints are given after customers have paid their bill, then the effect is lost.
sentences.chinese: 顧客付完賬後再給薄荷糖就沒有這個效果了。

sentences.english: If in doubt about your breath, suck a breath mint.
sentences.chinese: 假如你對自己的口氣不太放心，可以喫一塊薄荷糖。
希望他們會丟些薄荷糖。

sentences.english: She just curls up and sucks peppermints.
sentences.chinese: 她老是蜷着腿躺着，吮着薄荷糖。

sentences.english: The little boy, Johnnie, had been up with a packet of mints.
sentences.chinese: 小男孩約翰尼也上樓來過，送來一盒薄荷糖。

sentences.english: I don't suppose you have a breath mint on you, do you?
sentences.chinese: 我不指望你身上有薄荷糖你有嗎？

sentences.english: Conference table set with writing pad and pencils, bottled water, mints.
sentences.chinese: 會議擺臺包括便籤，鉛筆，礦泉水，薄荷糖。

sentences.english: Snubby Nose liked the idea of wintergreen candy.
sentences.chinese: 翹鼻子很喜歡喫薄荷糖的主意。

sentences.english: Brush your teeth, gargle or have a breath mint before getting up close and personal.
sentences.chinese: 10記得刷牙，親熱前請漱口或者嚼一顆薄荷糖。

definition: soft candy (gummi candy, gumdrop, jellybean etc)
Mentos, a brand of candy produced by European company Perfetti Van Melle
